name: Bull City, NC Schools & Libraries Achieving More (SLAM)
description: Through a partnership between Durham Public Schools (DPS) and Durham County Library, DPS students, teachers, and staff can access Durham County Library print and online resources.

name: HandsOn Triangle
description: HandsOn Triangle is the largest database of volunteer opportunities in the Triangle. Volunteers can search by interest, date, need, or organization.

name: Student Action Board
description: Participants evaluate community needs, organize service-learning projects, and build leadership skills through hands-on community work.

name: Habitat for Humanity of Durham
description: Volunteer on construction and site projects like painting, landscaping, framing, and cleanup to support affordable homeownership in Durham.

name: Teen Board Sponsored Habitat for Humanity of Durham
description: Teen Board (ages 14–18) provides leadership, mentorship, youth builds, engagement projects, and advocacy opportunities in the community.

name: SEEDs Volunteering
description: Looking to fulfill community service hours at SEEDS? Fill out the volunteer form to get started.

name: Church World Service (CWS) Durham
description: CWS Durham welcomes refugees, immigrants, and asylum-seekers through direct services, advocacy, leadership development, and community-building.

name: Communities Acting for Refugee Empowerment (CARE)
description: CARE connects refugee individuals and families with community groups that provide social and financial support toward education and employment goals.

name: Model UN Week
description: Students learn how Model UN can be a vehicle for learning about the world, civic engagement, and personal growth.

name: Women Build Sponsored Habitat for Humanity
description: Women Build empowers women to build, fundraise, and advocate for affordable housing while gaining hands-on construction experience.

name: Invasive Plant Removal at Wrightwood Park
description: Remove harmful invasive plants from Wrightwood Park as part of a community environmental restoration effort.

name: IMPACT CAMP
description: IMPACT Camps provide high school youth with an affordable, local, week-long community service/urban mission experience during the summer.

name: YMCA Triangle
description: The Y is a trusted place for connection, wellbeing, and growth with programs for youth development, health, and community engagement.

name: Mayor’s Award
description: Recognizes students throughout the Greater Triangle who volunteer 60+ hours during summer break. Application opens in March and closes in October.

name: Commissioners’ Award
description: Recognizes students throughout the Greater Triangle who volunteer 60+ hours during summer break. Application opens in March and closes in October.

name: Governor's and Key Volunteer Service Awards
description: County winners are submitted to the Governor’s office for statewide recognition; top volunteers may receive the Medallion Award.
